intro: Lotoxalis pinetorum, commonly known as the pine forest lotoxalis, is a flowering plant native to the humid forests of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a slightly hairy texture. Lotoxalis pinetorum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in association with pine trees.
